alert.note: Alert for Alger; Northern Schoolcraft (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 18 at 3:16PM EST until February 19 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 7 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Northwest winds gusting as high as 50 mph, strongest in open areas near Lake Superior after midnight creating blowing snow. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. South winds gusting as high as 40 mph into this evening creating blowing snow. * WHERE...Alger and Northern Schoolcraft Counties. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, from midnight tonight to 7 AM EST Saturday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until midnight EST tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills as low as 15 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Slow down and use caution while traveling.
